resources.string: Your device is not compatible with SnoopSnitch.\n

You need a rooted device with a Qualcomm chipset running stock Android 4.1 or higher. Unfortunately, custom ROMs are unsupported as they lack necessary proprietary drivers.\n \n For details, visit the project website (http://opensource.srlabs.de/projects/snoopsnitch). If you believe your device is compatible and this is an error, please send an email to our list gsmmap@lists.srlabs.de.

Thank you for contributing radio data related to this security event and supporting SnoopSnitch research and development!
 
 Please send details about this incident to snoopsnitch@srlabs.de (PGP fingerprint 9728 A7F9 D457 1FBB 746F 5381 D52C AC10 634A 9561). Do not forget your App-ID and the time the event happened. Thank you!
 
 This upload is encrypted. Keep in mind that radio traces may contain private data and location information. Have a look at the privacy policy on our project website on how we protect your data (http://opensource.srlabs.de/projects/snoopsnitch).

The active network test collects security information about your current mobile network by sending and receiving a number of SMS and by placing and receiving a number of automatic calls. It is normal to receive error status SMS from your operator during that test.
 
 The test should be free of charge. HOWEVER, YOUR OPERATOR MAY CHARGE YOU FOR OUTGOING SMS EVEN IF SENT TO AN INVALID DESTINATION!


 YOU MUST ONLY ENTER YOUR OWN PHONE NUMBER IN THE NEXT DIALOG. DO NOT PICK UP THE PHONE WHEN THE SERVER CALLS. IF YOU DO SO, YOUR NUMBER WILL GET BLACKLISTED AND BANNED FROM OUR SERVICE.

Following the test, the resulting radio data is uploaded to our servers automatically. If you do not agree with this, press Cancel now and disable recording for active tests in the settings menu.
 
 Note that radio traces may contain private data and location information as a side effect. Have a look at the privacy policy on our project website on how we protect your data (http://opensource.srlabs.de/projects/snoopsnitch).

Welcome! This is your first time running SnoopSnitch.
 
 READ THIS MESSAGE CAREFULLY BEFORE PROCEEDING!
 
 SnoopSnitch collects and analyzes mobile radio data to make you aware of your mobile network security and to warn you about threats like fake base stations, user tracking and over-the-air updates.
 
 This application uses data contributed by other users. By choosing to upload your measurement results or security events, you can help improve this data base and support future research.
 
 SnoopSnitch will ask for confirmation whenever any of your information is uploaded to our servers. All uploads are encrypted. Note that uploaded radio traces may contain private information as a side-effect. See our privacy policy on the project website
 for further information (http://opensource.srlabs.de/projects/snoopsnitch).
 
 Raw radio data is stored encrypted on your phone. However, for the continuous security analysis, SnoopSnitch needs to maintain data that may be used to reconstruct your movements and possibly message contents. This information is cleaned regularly - make sure to configure a cleanup interval that suits your needs.
 
 If SnoopSnitch's way of functioning concerns you, press Cancel now!

SnoopSnitch collects and analyzes mobile radio data to make you aware of your mobile network security and to warn you about threats like fake base stations, user tracking, and over-the-air updates.
 
 This application uses data contributed by other users. By choosing to upload your measurement results or security events, you can help improve this data base and support future research.
 
 SnoopSnitch will ask for confirmation whenever any of your information is uploaded to our servers. All uploads are encrypted. Note that uploaded radio traces may contain private information as a side-effect.
 
 If you have questions or want to contribute to SnoopSnitch, please send an email to our mailing list gsmmap@lists.srlabs.de. For a private conversion with the SnoopSnitch team, please contact snoopsnitch@srlabs.de (PGP fingerprint 9728 A7F9 D457 1FBB 746F 5381 D52C AC10 634A 9561).
 
 SnoopSnitch is open-source software released under the GPL license version 3. Visit our project website for source code and further information:
 
 http://opensource.srlabs.de/projects/snoopsnitch
Radio traces are purged from the phone that often
Information about your location is purged from the phone that often
Data from catcher and event analysis is purged from the phone that often
Debug logs are purged from the phone that often
Use fine-grained GPS-based location recording to get location information for IMSI catcher and security events
Use coarse-grained network-based location recording to get location information for IMSI catcher and security events
Record dump files in plaintext. Sensitive information is NOT removed from the device for you!
Store radio data encrypted with our public key.
Your can use your app ID to hint us at the files you uploaded. Refresh it anytime by tapping here.
Force using offline mode in active test. No data connection is used in this case.
Number of iterations for each active test.
Evaluate active test results on the phone only. No radio data is uploaded to our servers in this case.
You are about to refresh the app ID. Are you sure?
Done - please also test other network technologies
Device /dev/diag does not exist, probably your phone has no Qualcomm chipset
No working su binasettings_enable_devel_optionssettings_enable_devel_optionsy found, please check whether you phone is rooted
DO NOT ENABLE THIS, unless you are a SnoopSnatch developer!
This will crash SnoopSnitch on next start and reset this option. Used for testing crash handling. Leave this off ;-)
